_header: That I gave that is mine
Note:
A translation of a Latin distich found in Cambridge UK, Trinity College B.14.39 (323) f. 87v, printed by James (1900)
XJames, Montague Rhodes. Catalogue of the Western Manuscripts in the Library of Trinity College, Cambridge. 4 vols. Cambridge: at the UP, 1900-1904, 1.447 (Sunt mea si…). Cf. Walther (1963)
XWalther, Hans. Proverbia sententiaque latinitatis medii aevi. 6 vols. Göttingen, 1963-69, no.30764; see also 5139 and 5142.
Bibliographic Ghosts: Oxford, Balliol College 239, f. 77v (Mynors pointed out that Latin text against avarice on this page has similar subject to 5140); Cambridge UK, Pembroke College 32, f. 153: same as 5138.
_description: A tag in the Fasciculus Morum — one quatrain

Bod187.Transcription:
That y ȝaf þat ys mynþat was my þat y
                    etteBut þat y lefte by hynde meWho hyt shal haue y can nat
                    se

Bod410.Transcription:
þat I ȝaf þat is mynþat I ete þat was
                    mynþat I last by hynd me whoit shal haue I kon not se

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
þat y ȝaff þat is myneþat y ȝete þat
                    was myneþat y laft by hynd mewho it schalle haue I can not
                    se

BodRawC670.Transcription:
That y ȝaf þat ys mynÞat I eet þat was
                    mynnThat I lefte behynde meWho hit schallhaue I con noȝt
                    se
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 181.

CamGon71.Transcription:
Þat I ȝaf þat is mynþat I ete þat was
                    mynþat I left be hynd me who schal haue can I nogth
                    see

CamGon364.Transcription:
Þat I gaf þat is mynthat I ete þat was mynbut
                    þat y let be hynde meI ne wot qwos it schulden be

CamStJohn159.Transcription:
Þat I ȝef þat ys myneþat I ete þat was
                    myneþat I lost behynde meWho it sall hafe I can noȝt
                    se
CamStJohn159.Editions:
Reichl,  Karl,
                        ed.  
             Religiöse Dichtung im Englischen Hochmittelalter: Untersuchen und
                Edition der Handschrift B. 14.39 des Trinity College in Cambridge.
Münchener Universitäts Schriften, Text und Untersuchungen zur
                Englische Philologie 1
         Munich: Wilhelm Fink, 1973: 498.

EDU82.Transcription:
That I ȝaue that is mynethat I ete that was myneThat I
                    lefte be hynde mewhoo hit schal haue I can not see

Lincoln44.Transcription:
þat y ȝaue þat ys mynþat I hete þat was
                    mynþat I laft by hynd mehe sal it haue I kan noȝt
                    se

Spalding.Transcription:
That I gaf that is mynethat I ete þat was mynethat I left
                    be hynde meWho shall it haue I kan not se

WorcF19.Transcription:
þat y gaf þat ys myneþat y hete þat was
                    mineþat y last be kynd me wo
WorcF19.Note: Three lines only, written as prose.
